Exaggerate: The claim may be considered as an exaggeration because it states that "most" of North Carolina's legislators are in the "high risk age group" for coronavirus without providing specific data or evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the statement that "most" legislators are in the "high risk age group." There is no data or statistics provided to support this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the majority of North Carolina legislators are in the "high risk age group" without providing any factual basis or evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that while there may be some legislators in the "high risk age group," it is not accurate to claim that "most" of them fall into this category without further evidence or data.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making a broad and unsupported statement without providing specific evidence or data to support it.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Contradict fact: There is no evidence of contradicting facts in the provided claim.
